The Act is titled the "Access to Women's Health Care Act of 1997" and highlights the importance of women's health care, particularly the role of obstetrician-gynecologists in providing primary and preventive care throughout a woman's lifetime. An obstetrician-gynecologist plays a crucial role in improving women's access to healthcare by providing primary and preventive care throughout their lifetime, focusing on the female reproductive system. 60% of office visits to obstetrician-gynecologists are for preventive care, and they refer patients to other physicians less frequently than other primary care providers.
